Of course, I'd be happy to recommend some movies based on your preferences! If you're in the mood for a political satire with a hilarious cast, then "Head of State" might be right up your alley. Starring Lynn Whitfield and Tamala Jones, this 2003 film follows a Washington, D.C. alderman who finds himself unexpectedly picked as the replacement candidate for the presidency. It's a comedy goldmine with plenty of witty one-liners and memorable characters.

On the other hand, if you're in the mood for a zany, over-the-top comedy with an all-star cast, then "Airplane!" might be more your speed. Released in 1980, this classic parody film follows a group of misfits trying to safely land a commercial airplane after the crew becomes sick with food poisoning. With Jim Abrahams, David Zucker, and Jerry Zucker at the helm, you can bet there are plenty of hilarious moments and memorable characters to keep you entertained.
